verses.verse: (Job 29:14) The LORD has sworn in truth to David; He will not turn from it: “I will set upon your throne ((Ps. 89:3, 4, 33; 110:4)) the fruit of your body.
If your sons will keep My covenant And My testimony which I shall teach them, Their sons also shall sit upon your throne forevermore.”
(2 Sam. 7:12; (1 Kin. 8:25; 2 Chr. 6:16; Luke 1:69; Acts 2:30)) For the LORD has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His dwelling place:
“This ((Ps. 48:1, 2)) is My resting place forever; Here I will dwell, for I have desired it.
(Ps. 68:16; Matt. 23:21) I will abundantly bless her provision; I will satisfy her poor with bread.
(Ps. 147:14) I will also clothe her priests with salvation, (2 Chr. 6:41; Ps. 132:9; 149:4) And her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
(1 Sam. 4:5; Hos. 11:12) There I will make the horn of David grow; (Ezek. 29:21; Luke 1:69) I will prepare a lamp for My Anointed.
His enemies I will (1 Kin. 11:36; 15:4; 2 Kin. 8:19; 2 Chr. 21:7; Ps. 18:28) clothe with shame, But upon Himself His crown shall flourish.”
(Blessed Unity of the People of God) A Song of Ascents. Of David. [1] Behold, how good and how pleasant it is For (Job 8:22; Ps. 35:26) brethren to dwell together in unity!
It is like the precious oil upon the head, Running down on the beard, The beard of Aaron, Running down on the edge of his garments.
It is like the dew of (Gen. 13:8; Heb. 13:1) Hermon, Descending upon the mountains of Zion; For (Deut. 4:48) there the LORD commanded the blessing— Life forevermore.
(Praising the LORD in His House at Night) A Song of Ascents. [1] Behold, bless the LORD, All you servants of the LORD, Who by night stand in the house of the LORD!
(Lev. 25:21; Deut. 28:8; Ps. 42:8) Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, And bless the LORD.
The LORD who made heaven and earth Bless you from Zion!
(Praise to God in Creation and Redemption) Praise the LORD! Praise the name of the LORD; ((1 Tim. 2:8)) Praise Him, O you servants of the LORD!
(Ps. 113:1) You who stand in the house of the LORD, In (Luke 2:37) the courts of the house of our God,
Praise the LORD, for (Ps. 116:19) the LORD is good; Sing praises to His name, ((Ps. 119:68)) for it is pleasant.
For (Ps. 147:1) the LORD has chosen Jacob for Himself, Israel for His special treasure.
For I know that ((Ex. 19:5); Mal. 3:17; (Titus 2:14; 1 Pet. 2:9)) the LORD is great, And our Lord is above all gods.
(Ps. 95:3; 97:9) Whatever the LORD pleases He does, In heaven and in earth, In the seas and in all deep places.
(Ps. 115:3) He causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; (Jer. 10:13) He makes lightning for the rain; He brings the wind out of His (Job 28:25, 26; 38:24-28) treasuries.
